message.content: To find the area of a rectangular sheet of paper, Harriet only needs a ruler. The area of a rectangle can be calculated by multiplying the length of one side by the length of the adjacent side. By measuring the length and width of the paper with a ruler, Harriet can then multiply these two measurements together to find the area. A compass (B) is used for drawing circles and arcs, so it is not necessary in this case. A calculator (C) is useful for performing mathematical calculations, but it is not necessary for finding the area of a rectangle. Similarly, a protractor (D) is used for measuring angles, which is not relevant in finding the area of a rectangle.

By using a ruler, Harriet can measure the length and width of the paper, and then multiply those measurements together to find the area.
